citations.desc: Records: Operators of auction sales and brokers.
citations.narrative:
The licensee has not made, kept and maintained any records which fully disclose the required information concerning
animals consigned for sale via Facebook. The only record available was the actual Facebook post. A review of Facebook
posts from June 30, 2024 to October 9, 2024 shows multiple posts featuring photos of an animal along with a description
to include species and sex of the animal and a statement indicating that if the viewer is interested in purchasing the
animal they should reply. Posts viewed included the following: female kangaroo, multiple (sex not stated) marmosets,
male and female otters (small clawed), female spider monkey, and male capuchins. The licensee stated that she did not
take possession of the animals but acted as a broker posting the animals for sale for others and connecting the buyers
with the sellers. Keeping complete and accurate records is required of brokers whether or not a fee or commission is
charged in order to ensure legal and medical tracing of the source and sale of regulated animal species. The licensee
shall make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose all the required information concerning each
animal consigned for sale including the name/address of the owner, the name/address of the buyer, the USDA license
number of both persons if licensed or the vehicle license number/state and driver's license number/state if not licensed,
the date, and a full description of the animal including species/breed, sex, date of birth/approximate age and
color/distinctive markings. Correct by 11/1/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.76(a) 
   
Records: Operators of auction sales and brokers. 
The licensee has not made, kept and maintained any records which fully disclose the required information concerning 
animals consigned for sale via Facebook. The only record available was the actual Facebook post. A review of Facebook 
posts from June 30, 2024 to October 9, 2024 shows multiple posts featuring photos of an animal along with a description 
to include species and sex of the animal and a statement indicating that if the viewer is interested in purchasing the 
animal they should reply. Posts viewed included the following: female kangaroo, multiple (sex not stated) marmosets, 
male and female otters (small clawed), female spider monkey, and male capuchins. The licensee stated that she did not 
take possession of the animals but acted as a broker posting the animals for sale for others and connecting the buyers 
with the sellers. Keeping complete and accurate records is required of brokers whether or not a fee or commission is 
charged in order to ensure legal and medical tracing of the source and sale of regulated animal species. The licensee 
shall make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose all the required information concerning each 
animal consigned for sale including the name/address of the owner, the name/address of the buyer, the USDA license 
number of both persons if licensed or the vehicle license number/state and driver's license number/state if not licensed, 
the date, and a full description of the animal including species/breed, sex, date of birth/approximate age and 
color/distinctive markings. Correct by 11/1/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
